Once upon a time there was a little cat who wanted a house. He asked his mommy, "Can I have a house?" His mommy told him that she could, but only if he worked hard and saved five of his money. The cat was so excited that he started to clean his house every day. He worked very hard, cleaning his home and saving his money.

Once upon a time there was a small cat. The cat was very eager. It wanted to go to town and explore more. Every morning the cat put on a collar and set off.

One day the cat went to town. It stopped and paused to watch the people. They were wearing colorful collars so the cat could see what they were doing. 

The people in town stopped and asked the cat, "Why are you looking so eager every day? You should come see what other people are doing."

The cat smiled, "Yes, I am. I enjoy discovering new things and exploring the town." The people smiled and said, "We're glad you are curious and eager. You can come with us to explore, whenever you like!" 
 The cat was so happy and went off looking for more adventures.

Moral of the story: It is alright to be sleepy sometimes, but being too tired can make you forget about falling around too much.
Once upon a time there was a cat, a little cat, called Lucy. She wanted to go to the toilet. So she ran to find it.

When she got to the toilet, she saw a funny-looking frog.

"Hello," said Lucy. The frog was really happy. She said, "You want to have fun, be silly and wet. So you can squeeze in and enjoy the water."

Lucy was scared but she decided to trust the frog. She closed her eyes and squeezed tight in the toilet. 

But then, she had a bad feeling. The toilet was wet and Lucy was scared. She tried to swim away but the water kept coming. 

Finally she was too weak to get out. This gave up and Lucy gave up. She was safe! She learned that it was best to not trust everything she sees, even if it seems silly.
Once upon a time there was a big animal called a sheep called George. He was an honest farmer and wanted to pick a few of the sheep to give him. Every day, he would go out into the garden to pick the sheep. 

One day, he was picking the sheep, when he heard a voice. It was the sheep! They were in trouble, so George carefully stepped forward. 

“Please help me, George!” the sheep said.

George saw that one of the sheep had a very small cut. He realised the sheep wanted to have a better home in the farmer's field. 

“I can help you,” said George. He gave the sheep a special blanket that she had. It was made of sparkles and glimmers like a diamond.

The sheep was so happy! They stayed in the farmer's field for many days, looking at all the beautiful things inside the blanket. 
Once upon a time there was a curious cat named Sam. He liked to explore everything he saw in his backyard. One day, he was exploring around the garden when he saw a paw. He had never seen a paw before and he was curious about it. Without a second thought, he got closer to sniff it. 

At first, it was too soft and he let out a sudden roar. He was very confused. 

He asked the bear why he was roaring. The bear asked, "What was that?"

Sam thought carefully before answering. He looked up at the bear with a big, curious eyes and said, "I was just curious to see what was in the paw." 

The bear laughed and said, "A cute, fluffy cat! Would you like to play with me?" 

Sam said yes, and soon, they were playing together. They chased each other around the garden until they were both tired.

Once upon a time there was a little boy. He was 3 years old. He had a pet cat named Flash. The boy was very happy living with Flash. 

One day, the boy noticed Flash was feeling a bit tired. He said to Flash, 

"Come here, Flash! I want to play with you," he said.

Flash meowed and he was so happy that he started to play with the boy. He had so much fun with the boy. 

After a few hours, the boy said, "It's time for us to go home now." He picked Flash up and carried him back to the boy's house. 

The boy was very tired after all that playing. He was so happy that Flash had found a friend. The boy and Flash had many adventures together.
Once upon a time there was a fat cat. He was walking down the road and he was very excited. He saw a car driving very fast and wanted to follow it. So he followed the car for a long time until he came to a field full of little white bunnies. The cat was so excited that he kept following them as they sped around and around. He loved to watch the bunnies jump and play! The fox watched them and was so happy he decided to come too. He jumped up and followed the bunnies all around the field and they even followed the fat cat in the evening air. They were having fun and the fox wanted to join in the fun. So one day he hopped along with the bunnies and followed them all around, chasing each other and hopping behind them. They followed him everywhere they went and it was a great day! They never got tired of it. The fat cat and the little white bunnies were the best of friends
Once upon a time there was a little cat. She was really excited. She thought it would be fun to play a game. She wanted to find a way to reverse the game.

The cat got an idea. She knew that she could be patient and find the right numbers. But she was worried. She was sure that she could not make the game work, no matter how many numbers she had.

So she kept wondering. She thought and thought. Finally, she had an idea. She knew that she was too slow, so she decided to put one more number on the door.

The little cat pushed the door open and quickly took all the numbers she had wanted. She was happy that she had done her first game. The cat was very proud of her work. She had used her patience to get into the game.
